name: rhetorically
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of a question) in a way that makes a statement that does not expect an answer: "You want to know what courage is?" he asked rhetorically. I do not ask rhetorically, but because I would truly like to know the answer.
formal in a way that relates to using language effectively: Was he more rhetorically skilled during the debate? Probably. The administration was rhetorically strong on human rights but weak in practice towards China.
More examplesFewer examples"Why did it take so long?" Craig asked rhetorically.The woman then asks viewers rhetorically, “How do I know this?”Rhetorically speaking, he is unbeatable. A rhetorically gifted challenger once coaxed a defendant into declaring that carrots were sentient.
